intro: Paracolpodium, commonly known as the false colpodium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. The plants are perennial herbs with slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. They are native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Paracolpodium species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
